main event: A strange creature and some sort of air-borne object were seen by a number of people at Flatwoods, West Virginia on September 12, 1952.
interesting points: The object was egg-shaped with a smaller radius in front, bluish-green in color, and appeared to be the size of a basketball, but looked larger due to its proximity to the horizon.
The object was observed passing through an arc of approximately 30 degrees, at an angle of about 30 degrees from the horizontal, and was estimated to be about 65 miles above the horizon.
The computed velocity of the object was 13,000 mph and 2,600 mph, based on the distance it was assumed to have traveled.
The sighting lasted for approximately 5-6 seconds, and the visible flight was estimated to be 7-8 seconds based on the distance.
The object was observed by a number of people at Cornerlawn A.R.D., Point 160 - of A.B.C.M. computation, with specific instructions to write the report correctly.
sighted object: an egg-shaped, bluish-green object the size of a basketball
